About.aboutDescription:
My name is Yarelly, and I come from the land of llamas, ceviche, and the mysterious Macchu Picchu. 

After spending several years immersed in the world of luxury hospitality, I realized that the fast-paced rhythm just wasn't for me anymore. 

Weekends and holidays away from family start to take their toll after a while. 

So… how did I end up writing code? 

Scroll down to discover the story!

2010.title: First Contact with Code
2010.description: In primary school, I learned to code my first HTML tags. We were taught the basics, but I went further: I had fun creating a website to showcase my family's holiday photos.

2014.title: University Studies in Lima, Peru
2014.description: I studied tourism, management, and gastronomy with a strong focus on project management, strategic planning, and market analysis. I worked on economic viability, processes, and marketing using technological tools, while developing skills in project structuring, professional communication, and team coordination.

2019.title: Graduation in Tourism, Hospitality & Gastronomy
2019.description: I earned my degree, recognized by ERIC NARIC and evaluated at level 6 of the European Qualifications Framework. Thanks to my C1-level English and French and B1-level Italian, I was able to enter the international job market quickly.

2020.title: Language Immersions & Moving to France
2020.description: Between 2019 and 2020, I did several language immersion stays in the south of France, improving my French and discovering the local culture. Fascinated by the region, I chose to settle there in 2022, enhancing my international perspective and adaptability.

2022.title: InterContinental Marseille – Hôtel Dieu
2022.description:
I joined this iconic 5-star hotel in Marseille, where I developed cross-functional skills: teamwork, problem-solving, time management, and working under pressure.
[Click here to see what my former managers say about me!]

2025.title: Starting my studies at Epitech Montpellier
2025.description: I reconnected with my childhood passion for the web by starting my Master of Science at Epitech. I was already creating websites at age 10, and now, thanks to my network in IT, I'm rapidly developing my skills to turn this dream into a career.

cvOnline.title: Online CV
cvOnline.description: Responsive website featuring a double vertical carousel for an original and engaging navigation experience.

jobBoardStanley.title: Job Board – Stanley Jobs
jobBoardStanley.description: Development of a job board platform: job listings management, applications via a dynamic form, admin dashboard with authentication and full CRUD operations.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.description: Portfolio website designed to showcase my projects and skills. Clean, ergonomic and scalable design, with integrated CV download.
